studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Reduction in the number of primary composite events required for the interim analysis from 540 to 405.
Designation of pancreatitis and lower-extremity amputations as adverse events of special interest requiring 24-hour reporting.
Added exclusion criteria for subjects at high risk of lower extremity amputation.
Increased sample size from 3,700 to 4,200 subjects due to recruitment rates.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Beneficial effects of canagliflozin on renal outcomes may be detected with fewer events based on internal and external data.
To inform investigators of additional safety reporting requirements associated with events of pancreatitis.
Include new safety information and guidance regarding subject management surrounding the event of lower extremity amputations.
To include subjects with higher baseline HbA1c who may be at increased risk for renal and cardiovascular events.

studyChanges.summary: Decreased the number of primary composite events required for the interim analysis.

studyChanges.afterText: The subject is currently using disallowed therapy
studyChanges.summary: Updated language to accommodate subjects already using disallowed medication.
Increased the upper limit of HbA1c for study entry.

studyChanges.beforeText: when chronic dialysis or renal transplant is required
studyChanges.afterText: when chronic dialysis or renal transplant is initiated
studyChanges.summary: Clarified the trigger for study drug discontinuation regarding renal replacement therapy.
